results.title: Account Manager
results.description:
Mod Op is a full-service advertising agency in search of an Account Manager who is looking for growth and opportunity. At Mod Op you’ll work with internationally-recognized clients who represent a wide range of industries. You'll contribute to projects that propel brands to new heights. You'll collaborate with a team of committed, motivated, and enthusiastic coworkers who see career development and personal development as intertwined. And, thanks to ongoing growth-by-acquisition directed by our former-venture-capitalist CEO and our team of industry leaders, Mod Op offers a compensation package that includes access to low-cost, high-quality benefits, 401k with company match, paid parental leave, and a generous time off policy. Remote and flexible work arrangements are available based on role.

This position performs a combination of duties mainly related to leveraging Mod Op’s expertise and offerings to positively impact our clients’ business objectives. In conjunction with their supervisor, the Account Manager leads and supervises the planning and execution of all marketing communication activities on assigned accounts. He or she contributes in strategic areas and actively encourages the same from all members of the team. The position requires someone who is detail-oriented, poised, confident and proactive with exceptional communications and client service skills.

Job Responsibilities

  • Serve as the primary point of contact for assigned clients with responsibility for managing the planning and execution of marketing communications activities
  • Be the expert on Client and Agency business and understand as much as possible about the customer
  • Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to client needs and objectives
  • Clearly and consistently communicates to internal and external team members
  • Evaluate, analyze, report on program effectiveness based on key metrics and make recommendations for optimization
  • Assist supervisor with strategic development, program measurement and optimization recommendations
  • Serve as a trusted, reliable resource for clients
  • Be proactive, anticipate and solve problems

In addition, a top priority is contributing to the success of our clients as well as contributing to the creative and collaborative culture of the agency.

Requirements

Required Education and Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Four to six years of related work experience

 

Supervisory ResponsibilityThis position manages the client relationship(s) and is responsible for the internal team that services that client(s).

 

 

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work

Some flexibility in hours is allowed, but the employee must be available during the “core” work hours of 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and must work at least 40 hours each week to maintain full-time status.

 

 

Preferred Education and Experience

  • Experience across multiple marketing communications disciplines – specifically creative, social media, web and media
  • Ability to manage multiple clients and projects simultaneously
  • Excellent organizational skills and the ability to be resourceful
  • Planning and project management
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Analytical skills

 

 

Additional Eligibility Qualifications

 

None

 

 

Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Benefits

  • Health and Life Insurance for employee and family, access to Vision benefits, Telemedicine services, Psychology support and others.
  • On the job training and career growth opportunities
  • Fully remote job
  • Great team environment, collaborative offices, fun company culture with a great balance of work and play
  • Vacations are granted by day or weeks according to employee approved request.
  • Salary with yearly review and competitive benefits
  • Pay commensurate and competitive based on experience and skill set.

When asked what they love about working at Mod Op, we hear:

  • “I feel I can be myself at work and it’s fun!” -MV
  • “The caliber of the clients/brands we work with, knowing your work is seen by
  • thousands of people, in many cases across the world.” -JC
  • “We actually create videogames!” -AC
  • “We have an all-star team, and it’s like playing in the pro-bowl every day!” -MW
  • “Opportunities to always learn from and work with the best and the brightest.” HW
  • “Mentors and opportunities for growth.” -KB

Mod Op believes in teamwork, client collaboration, powerful storytelling, stunning design, and thoughtful problem-solving. Our clients represent a breadth of industries, and every project presents new and interesting challenges. We would love for you to join us!

results.title: Sales Account Manager
results.description:
NurseRecruiter is the largest nursing job board in the USA and we are looking for a qualified sales account manager to join our team. We are a 100% remote company and this is a 100% remote position so we are looking for someone anywhere in the United States. The base salary for this position is $40,000 USD per year with an unlimited commission plan that we expect to double the total compensation in the first year and grow from there.


You will be responsible for establishing and developing long-term relationships with customers and overseeing sales. As a sales account manager, you should work to satisfy customers’ needs and requests, respond to their queries in a timely manner and deliver a positive customer experience. You should have excellent communication and negotiation skills and be customer service oriented. Ultimately, you should be able to grow our business by building successful, long-term client relationships.

 

Responsibilities
  • Manage a portfolio of accounts to achieve long-term success
  • Develop positive relationships with clients
  • Act as the point of contact and handle customers’ individual needs
  • Generate new business using existing and potential customer networks
  • Resolve conflicts and provide solutions to customers in a timely manner
  • Supervise account representatives to ensure sales increase
  • Report on the status of accounts and transactions
  • Set and track sales account targets, aligned with company objectives
  • Monitor sales metrics (e.g. quarterly sales results and annual forecasts)
  • Suggest actions to improve sales performance and identify opportunities for growth

Requirements

  • Proven work experience as a sales account manager or sales account executive
  • Hands on experience in sales and an ability to deliver excellent customer experience
  • Excellent communication and negotiation skills
  • Business acumen with a problem-solving attitude

results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
Cloudsmith is looking for an exceptional full-time New Business Account Executive to work remotely. If you are hungry, nimble, and intelligent - with the ability and willingness to nurture leads and close business, we are looking for you.

 

Cloudsmith is a leader in software supply chain management. Allowing organizations to manage software via the cloud, eliminating the need to hire dedicated support staff to handle expensive and unwieldy on-premises solutions.

 

Our artifact management platform helps teams secure their software supply chain by providing a single place to store all their software assets. We provide a place to collect all the

  • external dependencies your team ingests,
  • custom software packages you create,
  • containers (eg Docker images)
  • Terraform modules
  • Helm charts (for container orchestration)

 

We help you control and manage these assets, automatically scan for vulnerabilities and malware, and improve your development team’s productivity.

You will be responsible for engaging and qualifying inbound leads, developing them into sales-qualified opportunities, and growing new business.

We are looking to expand our sales team and bring the value of our cloud-native offering to organizations.

 

About You, The Ideal Candidate

  • You are the customer’s champion. At Cloudsmith we aim to serve our customers by managing expectations and delivering what we promise.
  • You're entrepreneurial-minded. Enjoying the challenge of expanding new territory and having the ability in building a land-and-expand strategy.
  • You’re passionate about selling and technology and open to learning new things.
  • A team player. You understand selling is a team effort and partnering with your sales engineering counterparts is the path to success.
  • A skilled negotiator with the ability to quickly identify the right solutions that meet the customers’ needs to create a win-win situation.
  • You are skilled at driving projects in a startup environment with minimal guidance and limited resources while having the freedom and creativity to continue moving forward. You roll up your sleeves and drive execution and results.
  • You love to share a better way that you believe in with others as you know it will enrich their careers.
  • You exude the qualities and core values of Cloudsmith: loving automation, striving for simplicity, teaching others, and being humble.

 

In short, your qualities:

1. Smart. �

2. Gets Things Done �

3. An Awesome Human Being. �

 

Responsibilities

You will be responsible for qualifying inbound leads (MQLs) and developing them into sales-qualified opportunities.

  • Proactively engage with prospects and follow up with clients to meet their needs.
  • Nurture qualified leads and drive to conversion.
  • Develop an active and vibrant pipeline equal to 3x quota.
  • Offer initial solution overview and help identify customer goals/challenges.
  • Develop excellent relationships with potential and existing clients.
  • Performing research on accounts to help increase interest in the organization and our commercial offerings.
  • Prepare activity reports and update and maintain Salesforce.com.
  • Assist sales management in conveying customer needs to the marketing and technical support team.
  • Provide quotes, proposals, and support to senior sales.
  • Take ownership of rescheduling any postponed meetings and prompt follow-up of inbound inquiries.
  • Other responsibilities as needed.

 

Experience

  • Demonstrated success in meeting sales goals with a solid track record.
  • 5 years of sales-related experience.
  • Proven experience in sales within the IT sector. Ideally, you would have sold or prospected software, cloud, or DevOps solutions.
  • Proficiency in working in various CRM, sales prospecting tools, and web-based conferencing systems e.g MS Office suite, Salesforce.com, Intercom, and Zoom.
  • Ability to comfortably engage with technical buyers and procurement.
  • Great written and oral communication skills for creating professional documents and giving presentations to interested clients.
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills.
  • Ability to listen to concerns and handle criticism.
  • Positive attitude and want to be part of an energetic sales environment.
  • Expertise in conflict resolution.
  • Hungry to learn, genuinely curious, and know how to get the answers to your questions.

 

Working for Cloudsmith

You will be working as part of the core team to help drive more customer adoption with this game-changing technology.

 

The company is growing fast and we are focused on everyone at Cloudsmith to have a real impact on the company and our customers every day. We are driven, focused, and encourage creativity and collaboration.

 

About The Location

We’re based in Belfast, Northern Ireland, but like us and the entire team right now, you’ll be fully remote, with 24/7 access to a BT1 office space. We serve customers in the US and EMEA regions.

 

About Equal Opportunity

We’re an equal opportunities employer that does not discriminate against age, sex, gender, pronouns, race, disability, pregnancy, marital or parental status, political ideology, creed, sexual orientation, religious background, etc. Your ability and passion are infinitely more important to us.

 

Covid 19

Cloudsmith is committed to supporting Covid-19 vaccinations. We encourage our employees and their family members to get vaccinated, as it is the best way to limit the spread of COVID-19 and keep you, your family, our workforce, and communities healthy.

 

Requirements

  • 3-5 years sales related experience in B2B Saas/technology sales

- Prospecting, value-based / consultative selling, using effective discovery questions & identifying relevant customer initiatives

  • Industry knowledge

- DevOps, continuous integration & continuous deployment, containers (eg Docker), container orchestration (eg Kubernetes)

  • University degree (essential)

- Master's degree (or MBA) is desirable

Benefits

For excellent candidates like you, expect an incredible opportunity and compensation

💙 Extremely competitive salary

💙 25 days annual leave + 8 optional public holidays

💙 Birthday Day Off

💙 Remote & Flexible working policies

💙 Health / dental insurance

💙 Great pension contributions (matched up to 8%)

💙 Maternity/Paternity/Adoptive Leave

💙 Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Employer

💙 Branded hoodie, t-shirt, socks & swag

💙 Extra perks, like free conference days, or support for additional self-learning

results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
Over the last ten years, SaaS has changed the way we work — for the better. Slack instead of email. Miro instead of sticky notes. Airtable instead of Excel. SaaS is helping tech companies move so much faster, but it’s also introducing a new surface area of risk they’ve never seen before. The risk of leaking sensitive data. As a result, companies are faced with answering the difficult question of how to manage compounding security risks as they grow without introducing more red tape that slows their team members down.

At Metomic, we help tech companies save time & reduce costs by minimising their sensitive data footprint in cloud applications like Slack, Google Drive and Zendesk.

Our technology includes native integrations with dozens of cloud apps, AI to detect thousands of sensitive data types, and advanced functionality to manipulate data at scale (redaction, retention, access controls, etc). All from one place. This liberates tech companies to make full use of their favourite SaaS apps as they grow, whilst Metomic takes care of all the security risks behind the scenes.

After launching our product in April 2021, we now count some of the world’s most innovative companies as customers, such as Zego, Clearcover, Omnipresent, Travelperk and Jumio. Our revenue is growing quickly and we’re backed by some great investors like Connect (investors in CityMapper, Typeform, Marvel), LocalGlobe (Improbable, Figma, Zego) and RFC (Hopin, Clubhouse, On Deck, etc).


 

Our Team

Over the past year, our sales team (now 8 strong!) have taken our product to market and have been iterating our value proposition. We count some of the world’s most innovative companies as customers, such as Jumio, Zego, Clearcover, Omnipresent and TravelPerk. We’re entering a really exciting period in our growth journey and are looking to welcome a new Account Executive to the team to be part of this.

You will be responsible for building relationships with executives and decision-makers (usually CTOs, CIOs and CISOs), gaining a strong understanding of their business needs and priorities, and owning the sales delivery cycle from qualified lead through to onboarding transition with our Customer Success team.

We’ve set ambitious targets as a business and you will have ownership of a personal target each quarter. We’ve invested, and continue to invest, in the best tools on the market for our sales team so you can focus on what matters most.

We take learning and career development seriously and want Metomic to be an environment where you can grow and develop your skills down whatever path you’re most interested in. Some of our sales team have moved into more specialised roles, been promoted to new roles, or taken on people leadership responsibilities. We also have sales learning forums and ‘Revenue Hour’ where we come together as a team to move things forward and invest time in our own upskilling.

What you'll be doing

  • Develop product expertise - You will build your understanding of our product and industry to position yourself as a trusted advisor and expert to our prospects.
  • Build deep rapport and understanding of our customers - You’ll qualify prospective customer pain points with precision & depth, take time to understand their needs, and consider the value our solution can provide them.
  • Own the sales delivery cycle - You’ll be accountable for running our sales cycle from qualified lead through to onboarding transition to the Customer Success team. This will include demoing the product, objection handling, legal negotiation (with support from our legal advisors) and leading our Risk Reviews (our version of a POC).
  • Contribute to our GTM strategy - You’ll work closely with our SDRs to tailor messaging, approach and cadence, and with the wider Sales, Marketing and Leadership team on strategies for growing our presence across the market.

Requirements

  • Demonstrable experience in a B2B SaaS environment - You’ll be familiar and comfortable with the B2B sales cycle and demonstrate a track record of sales and hitting targets.
  • A strong listener who is inquisitive and curious - you’ll be building relationships, asking probing questions, actively listening to pain points and understanding how prospective customers might benefit from Metomic.
  • Very strong written and presentation skills - you’ll be the face and words of Metomic, so you’ll take time to sharpen messaging, pay close attention to details and communicate with impact.
  • Values- and relationship-driven - We’re a small, friendly and tight-knit team and we value kindness and empathy. You’ll own an individual target but also contribute to our sales team culture and team growth.
 
Our recruitment process

We know your time is important and want to make sure our recruitment process provides both of us a really authentic and meaningful insight into what it would be like working together, so we’re planning on the following stages:

  • Intro Call (30 mins) This will focus on your motivations and interests, your journey to date and some of the experiences you’ve had, along with a chance to share more about Metomic and the Sales Team
  • Skills Interview (1 hour) This will focus on your sales experience, decision-making and discuss our sales approach in more detail
  • Practical Interview (1 hour). This will involve a practical activity focused on written communication and presentation skills.
  • Interview with Rich Vibert, CEO (30 mins) - This will be an opportunity to speak with Rich, our CEO and Co-Founder, to learn more about our journey and strategy.

Benefits

Compensation
  • Our range is £45-60k base + Double OTE.
  • Our success is your success, so you’ll receive equity (under our tax-efficient EMI options scheme) as part of our annual grant process.
Life as a Metonaut 👩‍🚀
  • 🏡 Remote Working - We’re remote-friendly and also have a co-working space for those who prefer that.
  • 🏥 Private Health Insurance - Enrolled from Day 1 through Vitality, for when life happens.
  • 🏝 Holiday Leave - 25 days holiday leave, excluding bank holidays.
  • 🎉 Holiday Break - At the end of each year we close for 2 weeks to allow for a meaningful break for our people. This break is fully paid and in addition to Holiday Leave
  • 🎓 Learning Budget - £400 per year to invest in your growth
  • 🖥 WFH Budget - £150 per year to contribute to your home office
  • ✈️ Friendly & Social Team - We have regular team socials both in-person and online, including an annual team trip away (previous years have been in the South of France and Lisbon).
  • 💜 Working Environment - We’re a small, friendly and close-knit team who value kindness, transparency and autonomy to have an impact

#LI-Remote #LI-Hybrid

results.title: Sales & Reporting Analyst
results.description:
Position

Sales & Reporting Analyst

Location

Burlington, MA or remote within New England


About LightForce

LightForce is a 3D printing technology company focused on the orthodontic space. Our digital platform empowers orthodontists with 3D-printed tooth-moving tools. In 2019, we launched our first product - the world's only, fully customized 3D printed bracket system and digital treatment software. We are proud to be one of the fastest growing companies in the industry. Learn more at: www.lf.co

Description

The Analyst will report to the Senior Director of Commercial Operations. This individual will improve, execute, and effectively communicate significant analyses that identify meaningful trends and opportunities across the business. The Analyst will participate in regular meetings with management, assessing and addressing issues to identify and implement improvements toward efficient operations.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Prepare, analyze, and summarize various weekly, monthly, and periodic operational results for use by various key stakeholders, creating reports, specifications, instructions, and flowcharts
  • Provide strong and timely financial and business analytic decision support to business partners and various organizational stakeholders
  • Evaluate key performance indicators, provide ongoing reports, and recommend business plan updates
  • Interpret data, analyze results using analytics, research methodologies, and statistical techniques
  • Develop and implement data analyses, leverage data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
  • Conduct full lifecycle of analytics projects, including pulling, manipulating, and exporting data from project requirements documentation to design and execution

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree, preferably in computer science, mathematics, business management, or economics
  • Minimum of 3+ years' experience
  • Deep experience with managing budgets
  • The ability to present findings in a polished way
  • Proficiency with statistics and dataset analytics (using SPSS, SAS, Excel)
  • Entrepreneurial mindset, with an innovative approach to business planning
  • Valid Driver's license and ability to travel

Attributes

  • Strong work ethic
  • Advanced analytical skills with experience collecting, organizing, analyzing, and disseminating abundant information with accuracy
  • The ability to write reports
  • Exceptional verbal, written, and visual communication skills


Work Schedule/Hours

  • Regular business hours


Physical Demands

  • While performing the essential functions of this job, an individual is regularly required to sit or stand, walk, travel (vehicle and plane), see, use hands and arms, listen, and speak.

Perks

  • Unlimited PTO
  • Generous premium coverage for medical, dental, and vision plans
  • Fitness and wellness reimbursement program
  • Retirement account
  • Pre-tax commuter benefits program
  • Paid parental leave

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive company and we are most interested in finding the BEST candidate for the job. We would strongly encourage you to apply, even if you don't believe you meet every one of the preferred qualifications described.

LightForce has a Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy, which requires team members to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or be approved for a medical or religious exemption with accommodations in order to partake in certain activities in the United States.

LightForce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, Protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law

results.title: Inside Sales
results.description:
Company Description

Where do you find your local community news? How do you stay connected to new and old businesses in your community? Metroland Media is a communication company built on a strong history of providing the news to Ontario’s door steps for over 100 years. In this ever growing industry we have continued to evolve, allowing us to become the industry leaders. Flyers, magazines, trade shows, digital advertising and distribution is a snapshot of our companies breadth. If you are looking for a dynamic company built on a strong history within your community, look no further.

Our Commitment To Diversity
We strive to be a leader in building and cultivating an employee community framed around fairness, support and opportunity. We believe that what makes us different, makes a difference. And as a team, the diversity of our backgrounds, interests and experiences is what enriches our work, and our workplaces. We welcome all, and we strive for an inclusive culture that allows individual growth and shared success.



Job Description

Identifying a new opportunity through an ongoing trend to provide marketing opportunities to our clients in a more online and virtual way, we are creating a new high-performance virtual Inside Sales team to work solely from their home office.  We are currently searching for elite selling professionals to join this new team.

We are a looking for highly motivated, self-starters that understand customer-need based, consultative selling and can develop business prospects from multiple sources.  If you are an organized, persistent, and driven sales professional that thrives in a fast-paced environment while working exclusively from home, this role is for you.

The successful candidates will be responsible for prospecting, qualifying and generating sales revenue for both print and digital products across select Community markets. Individuals will have the ability to grow existing business, reestablish client relationships and initiate new business using industry leading sales support technologies.

This is an amazing opportunity for anyone interested in being able to work remotely from their home, anywhere in Ontario

 KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • Working from home developing sales via telephone, virtual and email communications
  • Follow up on inbound leads in line with established expected Service Levels
  • Manage targeted client and prospect lead list and a high volume of client accounts.
  • Conduct a needs analysis to help identify budgets and needs to recommend appropriate  product selections for clients.
  • Work daily with sales tools including CRM and Sales Engagement Platform
  • Build and cultivate client relationships by initiating communications and conducting follow-up communications in order to move opportunities through the sales funnel.
  • Track sales pipeline to consistently meet monthly revenue and client acquisition goals.
  • As part of this role, you will be required to handle credit card information. Metroland Media  is a PCI compliant company and requires people in this role to take PCI training to handle cards in a safe and compliant manner.



Qualifications
  • Minimum 1 -3 years of sales experience.  Print and digital media experience an asset.
  • Creative thinker that has a professional, positive and enthusiastic attitude
  • Demonstrated ability to meet and/or exceed determined sales and activity quotas
  • An expert at getting to the Right Party Contact
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Comfortable in using Sales Support digital technology including a CRM system.
  • Highly self-motivated and accountable



Additional Information

AODA
Metroland is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free recruitment process ensuring equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Ontario Human Rights Code we will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify the hiring manager upon scheduling the interview of your requirements.

results.title: Sales Development Representative
results.description:
We believe in the power of process and its potential to unlock growth in teams everywhere.

Who We Are:

Process Street is a no-code workflow platform startup from San Francisco. We help our customers build, document, automate, and track recurring workflows. Our platform stores knowledge where the action happens, ensuring thorough and error free execution of workflows that our global customers run their businesses on. We service over 3k customers around the world, such as Airbnb, Spotify, AstraZeneca, and Accenture, and are VC-backed by Accel, Salesforce, and Atlassian.

Our Mission:

To make recurring work fun, fast, and faultless for teams everywhere.

Our Culture:

Process Street was founded on a strong belief in the work-life benefits of a healthy, collaborative remote culture. We value flexibility because many of us are parents, travelers, or just creatives who aren't inspired by the construct of a mundane 9-to-5. Spread across 9 different time zones, we communicate asynchronously, work autonomously, and take real ownership of our work. We know human connections are what make teams strong, so we regularly do coffee chats, game-playing, story-telling, and more, to build strong relationships.

If you’re entrepreneurial and seek an environment that values impact, ownership, and flexibility we look forward to meeting you! 

The Opportunity:

The Sales Development Representative is an exciting commercial development opportunity that will report into our Director of Sales. You’ll play a pivotal role as the first point of contact for new customer leads by adding a personalized touch to engage with our potential new customers; utilizing various modes of communication (chat, email, phone, video, and social media).

In this role, you will partner with Account Executives and Relationship Managers to identify opportunities for improving our team’s customer conversion rate. Strong collaboration and relationship building skills are a must, as this role involves working with diverse stakeholders across multiple teams. 

As an SDR you’ll have the opportunity for professional progression into other functional areas within the Sales & Marketing Teams. 

For this position, we are looking for someone located in Pacific, Mountain, or Central time zones.

What You’ll Do:

  • Follow up with leads via chat, email, phone, video, and social media
  • Research target accounts and perform outreach through emails, calls, and social media
  • Perform minor discovery to identify the needs and scale of an opportunity
  • Schedule qualified opportunities with our Account Executives
  • Research and personalize communications to high-value leads
  • Design systems to better improve your funnels and performance

What You Bring to the Table:

  • A sharp and hungry mindset, with pure excitement for a career in SaaS Sales
  • A natural knack for learning new technology
  • A solid understanding of SaaS business models with strong business acumen
  • A growth mentality - you have a self motivated approach to learning and development
  • A natural intellectual curiosity coupled with resolute grit
  • Excellent communicator, both written and verbal

Our Fav[ou]rite Perks:

  • Unlimited PTO policy – Most take 3-4 weeks, plus their major holidays, AND a company-wide week off in December.
  • Annual company offsite - We are excited for our global team retreat in Portugal in Fall of 2022. We also encourage and sponsor small group meetups so that you can meet your teammates face to face around the world throughout the year.
  • Social time – We know human connections are what make teams strong. We regularly do coffee chats, game-playing, story-telling, house tours (only if you're comfortable), and more to build connections.
  • Generous health insurance for US employees and their families, including dental and vision plans.
  • Equity for all full-time roles.

Confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. But we'll let you in on a secret: there's no such thing as a 'perfect' candidate. Research tells us that applicants who are female, non-binary, or people of color are less likely to apply to a role if they feel they don’t meet every qualification. If you feel you meet most of the qualifications, regardless of how you identify, and this is a role that would make you excited to come into work every day, please apply! Process Street is a place where everyone can grow.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, genetic information, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status.

results.title: Methodiq Sales Development Representative
results.description:
Methodiq powers the digital transformation of diagnostic laboratories, bringing them into the modern era and allowing them better IT operations to secure more revenue. Our team was built by highly experienced lab experts and engineers who have over 25 years of technical expertise to build solutions specific to this healthcare niche.  

 

We're looking for an SDR that will help us drive success through our digital engineering arm, while leading us through the next chapter of our rapidly expanding business. Alternatively, should you be both sales-savvy and technically knowledgeable with ample experience in the laboratory sphere, we are open to hiring a Senior VP of Sales. 

 

The right individual will be self-driven and excited to help build a world-class sales culture from the ground up. Our sales and marketing teams have worked harmoniously together, but lack a structural framework that will allow us to meet the incredible demands of our niche industry. Methodiq (in conjunction with sister-company Gistia) continues to offer expanded services and a unique product portfolio, furthering a myriad of future opportunities should we cultivate a team capable of securing them. 

 

About you: 

You aspire to lead and build; to grow beyond your current role: 

  • You are responsible for pipeline generation 
  • Your goal is to proactively build new relationships with individuals in our target demographic (laboratory management) 
  • You have an opinion on sales methodology, how to do discovery, and what to say to customers 
  • You'll utilize “Account Based Marketing” sales strategies, and some unique to you 
  • You'll have experience in healthcare, ideally laboratories; live and breathe their language 
  • Drive outreach activity to secure remote and in-person meetings and demonstrations 
  • You'll continually develop, improve and populate our core outreach cadences in collaboration with our Marketing team 
  • You will establish new business relationships via telephone, email, social media, networking events and content collaborations 
  • You will qualify inbound leads (MQL) to ensure quality leads are passed over to the commercial team 
  • You will maintain and police CRM accuracy  
  • You'll utilize Hubspot and Linkedin (as well as others) to grow our CRM within our defined target audience 
  • You'll be the one to steward MQLs through appropriate cadence activity 
  • You are the HUNTER in our sales process:

What you don't need to be: 

  • An expert in software development, data, machine learning or deeply technical (though we will bring you up-to-speed in what you'll need to know) 
  • A sales operations leader 
  • A contracts or legal expert

results.title: Sales Representative
results.description:
About Ergeon

We are disrupting the trillion-dollar construction industry with technology, making it possible for almost any profession to operate remotely. Our company is the only startup combining the strengths of technology and remote work to solve the challenges of residential construction. 

Unlike most other products and services, hiring a contractor for a home improvement project is very far from a 1-click experience today. Ergeon aims to empower skilled local contractors with human and technology-powered services to make home improvement easy. We take a full-stack approach to create a seamless experience for homeowners, and leverage technology to scale the front & back offices of contractors.

With the belief that everyone has a right to professional growth and respect regardless of their location, we proudly have staff (aka Ergeoneers) in dozens of countries, with a great score and recommendation rating on Glassdoor.  Come join us to make construction friendly and accessible!

 

Ergeon: [er - g- eon]

Erg = unit of work or energy

Eon = billion years

 

Ergeon is founded by CS Ph.D. serial entrepreneurs Jiayue (Jenny) He and Odysseas Tstatalos. They picked this name to symbolize their joint passion for using tech to revolutionize work. 

 
Overview of the Role

The Customer Specialist role is a transitional phase to  the Senior Customer Specialist role, meaning that if you do well, you’ll have the opportunity to build a sales career path in the company. Once you have built a strong customer portfolio and proven a successful track record, you will opt for a performance review to get promoted to the Senior Customer Specialist role.


As a Customer Specialist, you will be the voice of Ergeon to new leads interested in our home services products. From first conversations to closing the deals, you will support Ergeon’s growth by walking customers through a high-touch, customer-oriented sales experience approach. Whether getting to know the lead’s needs, quoting and closing a project, or sharing Ergeon’s value proposition, you will be focused on listening and creating the best customer experience above all else.

 
Responsibilities

As a Customer Specialist at Ergeon a typical day will include the following:

  • Managing open deals (leads).
  • Communicating with leads via inbound calls, emails, and text messages.
  • Making outbound calls to qualify new customers.
  • Handling leads from qualification, to quoted and closed stages through single touch point interactions (end to end sales cycle). When not possible, you will need to set the appropriate follow up activities.
  • Managing your customer pipeline through the usage of CRMs and other various tools.
  • Sending quotes, clarifying questions, and closing deals to drive the Company’s revenue.
  • Using your sales expertise to mentor Junior Customer Specialists.
 
Desired Skills and Experience
Must have
  • 3+ years of advanced experience in B2C and/or B2B Sales
  • Strong communication, customer rapport building and closing skills.
  • Ability to master new products and concepts quickly.
  • Proven track record of end-to-end pipeline management and achieving monthly revenue targets.
  • Ability to define and refine new sales processes.
  • Attention to detail, organization and prioritization skills.
  • Time management and discipline.
  • Sense of urgency and multitasking skills.
  • Being able to handle high work volume efficiently.
  • Proven track record of closing deals, metric compliance and proficiency on multi stage end-to-end sales cycles.
  • Proficiency and fluency in English (business etiquette).
  • Ability to work under pressure and dynamic target environments.
  • Experience using pipeline management or productivity tools like Pipedrive, Talkdesk, or Front among others.
  • Previous full-time remote work experience.
Nice to have
  • Sales experience in general labor or construction industry.
  • Sales leadership and management experience.

 

Technical Requirements

Good Laptop setup with Chrome browser

  • Minimum of 8GB RAM
  • Minimum processor:
    • For Intel variants of CPUs:
      • Core i3 8000 Series (8th Gen) or higher
      • Pentium N5000 series (Quad-core variant) or higher
      • Celeron J5000 series or higher (quad-core variant)
    • For AMD variants of CPUs:
      • Ryzen 3, 3rd generation or higher

 

Stable high-speed internet connection

  • At least 5mbps upload and 20 Mbps download

 

Headset

  • With a noise cancelling microphone

 

Power backup

  • 250-300W UPS

 

Data availability

  • Ability to access up to 1.5GB of data per day during storm outages
 
Compensation

Monthly salary between $1.200 - $1.500 USD + Commissions.

  • Commissions are based on a tier model that accounts for the revenue that you bring to the company.
  • Your final compensation will depend on your placement on our Career Ladder and will be calculated hourly.
  • You'll be paid weekly through Upwork (www.upwork.com), the platform we choose to hire and pay our Ergeoneers all over the world.
 
Additional important information
Bootcamp
  • World-class Sales Training of 4 weeks including: 1-1 sessions, constant mentoring, teamwork, practical use and understanding of our technical tools, and live exercises to develop abilities.
  • You are going to be able to do a full immersion in the day-to-day job, enjoy our amazing company culture, make great friends, and learn a lot!
  • We are completely convinced that this period gives you the opportunity to decide if the job and the company are your perfect match, and it also helps us to know you better.
Availability
  • The position is full-time, based on a 40 hours week.
  • Availability Monday through Sunday from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM PST/CST/EST.
  • The expectation is to cover at least 40 scheduled hours that fall on any of the days mentioned above.
  • Most commonly this will mean working 4 days of the week + 1 weekend day.
 
Ergeon’s benefits and perks for full staff members

Competitive compensation: We invest in people! We are constantly doing worldwide market research in order to offer globally competitive salaries. And we are well funded by VCs.

  All-Remote since the beginning: We have a diverse team spread across 40+ countries. We stay connected through the best remote work practices such as flexible work hours, team events, remote happy hours, and by sharing our love of food!

    Tech, Wellness & Learning fund: You can have a $400USD bonus per year for software and hardware tools, workplace improvements, fitness-related spending (includes things like yoga classes, Fitbit tracker, new running shoes, gym membership. . .), and books, courses, training, or even attending conferences.

  Stock options: All staff is eligible after 6 months of full-time work.

  Birthday Paid day off: You can take the exact day, or Friday before if it is on a weekend!

  Flexible Paid time off: You can take 12 days after working 6 months, PLUS 2 extra days per year for a maximum of 20 days.

  Free Headset Benefit: You can get a noise-canceling headset since your first day working full-time.

  Equipment: Laptop replacement after 1 year of full-time work. And every 3 years after that.

   Co-Working Fund: Meet in groups of 3+ Ergeon friends and get reimbursed up to USD $20 for coffee, co-working, etc (once per quarter).

  Language Classes: here at Ergeon you will have the opportunity to learn or improve a language!

 

We believe everyone has a right to professional growth and respect, no matter their location.

Ergeon’s workforce is given meaningful opportunities and is supported by a kind and diverse community.

Our global staff (Ergeoneers) have access to career growth, amazing work culture, and great benefits.

Come join us to transform the construction industry!

results.title: Sales Director EMEA
results.description:
Who we are

80% of the workers across the globe are Deskless. These are the people who keep our lights on and gas flowing, build roads and bridges, run our manufacturing factories, ensure that we get healthcare service, and provide us reliable phone and internet connectivity. As entrepreneurs, have we considered solving their problems and making them more productive?

If you are still reading, and connect compassionately about this underserved segment, come and join us to drive Technology Equity in the global workforce.

At Zinier, we are on a mission to enable these 2.7 B Deskless Workers achieve greater success for themselves and the world around them. Guided by a deep understanding of their needs, we design software experiences that enable every Deskless Worker to excel in the field.

We are a remote-first global team headquartered in Silicon Valley. Our hybrid workforce is spread across London, Lisbon, Mexico City, Singapore and Bangalore, and leading investors, including Accel, ICONIQ Capital, Founders Fund, Newfund Capital, NGP Capital, Tiger Global Management and Qualcomm Ventures LLC.

 

What we are looking for

Has your growth plateaued selling enterprise software in a big company environment? Are you crushing your quota, but want to take a step up with more responsibilities and opportunity to grow a team? Are you looking to experience the crazy chaotic rewarding world of a fast growing, well funded, tech startup solving real world problems?

If you are a process-driven sales professional with a strong track record of exceeding sales goals and selling enterprise SaaS solutions; if you have a proven record of landing enterprise level accounts and dealing with complex sales situations with multiple stakeholders; if you have demonstrated experience in articulating the value proposition, and negotiating agreements in the software industry; if you want your work to make a difference in the lives of the deskless workers, and if you're passionate about new technology, we'd love you to join our world class team.

Reporting to the VP of Sales EMEA, you will be the primary owner of all sales and business development activities in your assigned region. You will play a key role in developing new business and managing key accounts to rapidly grow the company. You will be responsible for implementing a structured sales plan aimed at generating new business, and to build strong, trust-based relationships with customer decision makers at the “CXO” level.

 

What the role requires

  • Deliver against quota in your assigned region and vertical
  • Development of account  plans to communicate and drive account strategy, and ensure organisational alignment 
  • Report all sales activities through Zinier's CRM system.
  • Create quarterly forecasts including committed deals as well as pipeline for the current quarter and beyond
  • Participate in weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual reporting and sales cadence
  • Work cross functionally to support the success of Zinier customers and ZInier in your focus markets
  • Manage all opportunities by navigating the critical success factors, competitive challenges, partner landscape, objections and other complex issues to ensure successful outcomes in the territory.  
  • Being the trusted advisor to the customer by understanding their existing and future IT roadmap to drive the Zinier solution within the market
  • Continuously make us a better company and help us grow

 

What you'll bring to the role

  • We are looking for self-starters who relish the opportunity that a company in growth stage presents
  • Minimum 5 years of Enterprise Software Sales experience; proven performance against targets
  • Preference will be given to candidates with a background and network in  Telecoms
  • Language skills in English, but also another European language such as Spanish, German, French or Italian would be a plus
  • Ability to develop, negotiate and close customized deals effectively
  • Top-notch communication - in person, written and presentations
  • Technology minded, with the ability to explain high-tech info to a variety of audiences
  • Able to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
  • Experience working in start-up or entrepreneurial environments
  • Time management, prioritization, and the ability to self-motivate
  • A passion for networking, establishing rapport with potential clients and sharing the Zinier mission
  • Dedicated to giving and receiving feedback in all directions for the good of each teammate and the organization
  • Intellectual curiosity and problem solving skills
  • Experience with tools like PowerPoint, Salesforce, Google Suite
  • Honesty, Humility, Hunger, Hustle

 

When submitting your resume, please state performance against quota for the past two years.
